Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2012 03:47PM Dawn7 wrote: Hi, Grier, Thank you for info- I appreciate it. For everyone, as far as sentinel biopsy, I had heard some scary things so I made a pest of myself asking questions about it- asked if it hurt, could I be numbed first, etc. Anyway.... Day of BMX comes- anesthesiologist says" no one had complained before and he actually said, " I never really gave it much thought." So i mentioned to the preop nurse, that perhaps he would think about it if a needle was going to be inserted in HIS privates- end of story- they put me out for it. Ha!
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2012 06:54AM Dawn7 wrote: Hi, ladies. I have enjoyed reading your posts, makes me feel less alone. I had bilateral masectomies on Oct. 25- came home on the 26 with 2 drains- ugh- the worst part. No reconstruction. I know I had invasive mammary ca/mostly lobular 4mm and lcis, atypical ductal and lobular hyperplasia. My nodes were negetive.I don't know stage or grade, etc until I get pathology report later this week on followup. The pain medication makes me sick even with phenergan so I'm not taking it. I don't miss my breasts one bit as I consider they were trying to kill me. The anxiety is not knowing results of path report so i can make a plan and honestly, worrying about finances. Other than that , the BMX was not a huge deal.
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2012 08:21PM Dawn7 wrote: Hi, Politicomama. I had a BMX last thursday and my cancer side is flatter too! I see the surgeon tomorrow so I will ask him. I don't plan to have reconstruction so I was hoping to kinda match- so we'll see. Maybe they can fix it later, I hope.
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2012 03:49PM Dawn7 wrote: I should explain I was referring to the injection of dye- not the removal of the nodes.
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2012 08:31PM Dawn7 wrote: Dear Soteria205, I will pray for you, honey. Sounds like your nodes were doing their job so hopefully they caught all the bad stuff. I am getting my path report tomorrow- it's a scary business but I'm glad to get a plan- time to kick cancer in the you know what. Hugs, Dawn
Posts.Title: October 2012 Surgery? Leigh22 ConnieGreene

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2012 10:52PM Dawn7 wrote: Hi. I had a BMX on Oct 25 2012 for ILC. I choose no reconstruction and don't regret it. I am very fortunate in that the tumor board reccomended no further treatment as the Ca was small and I am post menopausal. But heres the thing- I find myself suddenly depressed with a feeling of unreality about the whole process. I'm also scared about cancer being " somewhere else" as two of my relatives died of ovarian cancer. I am gene negative. They didn't do any scans. Are these feelings normal?? I was proud of myself for being brave before- now I'm feeling kind of wimpy.
Posts.Title: just had mastectomy feeling sorry for myself karensimone Beth1951

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2012 02:42PM Dawn7 wrote: Hi, Mena, I am pleased you are happy in your decision to have reconstrution. I chose not to have it because I think I look fine without breasts. My feelings of sadness 10 days out are more about having experienced cancer than not having new breasts and concerns about a reoccurence elsewhere. That said, I am profoundly grateful to be alive and am thankful to my radiologist who spotted a very small invasive cancer before it could do more harm. Take care, Dawn
Posts.Title: just had mastectomy feeling sorry for myself karensimone Beth1951

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2012 05:55PM Dawn7 wrote: Mena, After taking another look at my previous post, I think I came off as a bit self righteous. I hope no one took offense. I appreciate all the different view points about the choices women have after masectomy and am glad that this website gives a voice to so many going through such a difficult and stressful time. I have received tons of support and advice which has helped me get through this. Thank you ladies. Dawn
Posts.Title: just had mastectomy feeling sorry for myself karensimone Beth1951

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2012 10:04PM Dawn7 wrote: Mena, You are happy with your decision and that is a good thing! No offense taken at all but.... My breast oncology surgeon supported my decision NOT to have reconstruction and for that I am also grateful. The beauty here is we are both pleased. :0). Here's to diversity - boobs, foobs or flat. More importantly- heres to more research, funding and finding a cure and ways to prevent this horrible disease in the first place!!! Dawn
Posts.Title: just had mastectomy feeling sorry for myself karensimone Beth1951

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2012 08:59PM Dawn7 wrote: My heart goes out to anyone waiting for biopsy results. I had a mammogram, dreaded callback for ultrasound followed by core biopsy , a week waiting for those results of atypical ductal and lobular hyperplasia, two weeks later, I had an excisional biopsy and tomorrow I finally get the results. My GP doesn't believe in anti anxiety meds- I am embarrassed to admit that I have been terrified from the start. My first cousin has the BRCA 2 gene and I have been tested for that also with results pending. I realize that my fear is no big deal in a world filled with much larger issues but .... Geez- this sucks!!
Posts.Title: Advice about panic before learning biopsy results? chicagocarol marywh
